description: A very simple checklist app implemented first in the command line and then as both a web-app with streamlit and a desktop GUI with FreeSimpleGUI.
A website, built entirely in Python using streamlit, to showcase the apps I built as part of Ardit Sulce's Python Udemy mega-course, and my subsequent personal coding projects.
A script that generates multipage PDF templates given some predefined guidelines stored in a csv data structure.
A script that reads invoice-style records from Excel files and automatically generates formatted PDF invoices.
A script that pulls the top three news stories from TheNewsAPI, formats some summary data about them into an email, and sends the email.
A REST API built with Python and Flask to serve up to 200 years of historical weather data from cities across the world.
A data web app that retrieves current weather data from the OpenWeather API and displays it using various visualisation techniques on a streamlit website.
A script developed in Jupyter Lab that finds the most common non-stopword in a novel, and performs chapter by chapter sentiment analysis using the nltk library.
A program that monitors the computer webcam and sends an email when a new object enters and then exits the view.
A program that checks a music band's website, stores tour information in a SQL database using sqlite3, and sends an email when a previously unregistered tour is published.
A basic hotel booking system backend designed for a multi-hotel company and built using object-oriented programming.
A basic streamlit website that uses the nltk library to perform sentiment analysis on news stories pulled from TheNewsAPI and display only the most positive.
A school database management system frontend GUI built using OOP with the PyQt6 library.
The backend for managing the MySQL database and handling queries received from the student management system frontend.
A simple GUI built with tkinter that uses selenium to automate a variety of interactions with a webpage such as logging in and requesting downloads.
A job application page built using Flask and Jinja2 to display dynamic information based on what the user inputs.
A multiuser job application webpage built using Django and Jinja2 to retrieve and write data to a database accessible by an administrator user.
A Django webapp to let customers see a restaurant menu and meal availability from chefs who are able to log in as special users and add meals.

A series of Jupyter notebooks initially written in Deepnote that use various scikit packages for popularity-based, collaborative, and content-based filtering of movie lists in order to make recommendations.
An AI agent built using LangChain and Google AI to help with managing tasks on the Todoist app, and an AI chatbot with a gradio web UI and the personality of Sherlock Holmes.
